items.sentence: If you don\'t want to go to that party, you don\'t have to.
If you leave now, you\'ll be in Boston by tomorrow evening.
I stopped by your office yesterday, but you weren\'t there.
I suppose you already know that Tom doesn\'t want you here.
I suspect that Tom and Mary don\'t really enjoy doing that.
I think I would\'ve heard the door open if Tom had come in.
Tom asked a few questions that Mary didn\'t want to answer.
Tom didn\'t want anyone to know that he was deeply in debt.
Tom didn\'t want to be seen naked, so he hid in the bushes.
I don\'t want there to be any chance of a misunderstanding.
